div.p: I wrote to you through Herter three days ago.

Now I am sending what I received yesterday during dinner; for by chance I met a good man, a fellow citizen of ours, who, I know, will deliver everything to you in good faith. Hoser sent me two copies of his booklet, which you receive here, so I am sending one to you. But if in the letters addressed to you, another matter of a different argument is perhaps suggested, please make sure to share it with me. Farewell, my venerable and dearest brother. January 3, 1561.
Hoser writes absolutely nothing new, except what he usually does about those ubiquitous ones, etc.
